Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: btpersons
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on the bus route,walking distance a lot of attractions and they have the best coffee in town. The room was quiet and coortable and the staff helpful...great experience on our 5 day stay in December of 2011

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: goSFO
Reviews.Content: Taxi from hotel to airport Fiumicino 45 euro + 5 tip, about 40-45 min. Taxi hotel to Roma Termini (Central Train Station) 12 euro + 3 tip, about 15 min. Hotel. Staff is nice and helpful. Rooms are clean. Breakfast 6:30 to 10:30 am, continental. Try to avoid upper floor (5th), can be too hot. Second floor is much better. Leave some of your luggage in hotel if you're planning to be back on your way home. A couple good places to have a dinner nearby: Pupina (your mom Italian food) and La Piccola Irpinia (they even have a little buffet). And don't be afraid, every major site within walking distance. Take a walk to Colosseum, no more than 25 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sunlover85England
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my friend for 3 nights, was impressed with size of room. Rooms very clean and breakfast we didn't have much of but had the basics. Hotel is in a great location, only 5-10 min walk to Spanish steps and Trevi fountain across the river. About 15 min walk to Vatican, we used Rome app on iPhone which was great had a map so used that the whole time. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “recent visit”
Reviews.Author: usdublin
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean,but breakfast very disappointng. Little choice. Had to clear table before able to sit and eat. Breakfast staff very indifferent, too busy talking with "favoured"guest, and describing special orange from the garden!! Guys at reception very nice and helpful.No information in the room regarding hotel or surroundings..... however would recommend as base for visit to city.

Reviews.Title: “Not a three-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: KonstantinaPapa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is placed in a great location, just 10 min walking from Spanish Steps and the main sites. When we entered the room, there was a really weird smell coming from the furniture and the carpet (that reminded me of my grand-mothers home), however after leaving the window open for a few hours every day, we could not notice it after a couple of days. The room was quite small but warm (temperature), the bathroom was the best place as it was rennovated and clean. The matrices were quite old and a bit uncomfortable for a 3 star hotel. We had clean towels every day and room service was great. I have to say though, that it was quite noisy since the cleaning would start around 8 from the corridors, using hoover that was walking us up. Our breakfast contained only a few things and the quantintes were not always sufficient so if we would go after 9,30, we could not find enough a couple of the days we stayed. All in all, it did not meet our expectations for its price but perhaps. Have in mind the extra charge of 2euros per person per night that is in force for tourists in Italy: although we had pre-paid the hotel, this was not included and the receptionist did not informed us during checking but at the check out! We noticed though that he informed some other customers that they arrived when we were leaving

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: C T
Reviews.Content: We found the staff very friendly and helpfull. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. It is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny room....”
Reviews.Author: georgeny01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in April,2011. The location was excellent. But the staff was not so friendly and the rooms were very small. In all fairness my wife complained about the room and they did upgrade to a top floor suite. average size room not a suite.

Reviews.Title: “Remember, it's a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: PJsd66
Reviews.Content: Excellent, excellent location. Near all the main sights. We walked to everything and never took a taxi. Mid range priced Resturants are close by. Our double room was a little tight but comfortable, clean and quiet. It faced the inner courtyard. Staff was very helpful, but remember no room service. They told us to remember it's a 3 star hotel not 5. Free Internet in the room and was super easy to log onto. Pay the extra $10 a day for the breakfast. It makes the morning start go easier. Not great but average fare. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LM-Delaware
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked this hotel for us........great location to all the main attractions. Front desk was great, especially Gian. Clean room, new bathroom and while it lacked extra outlets in the room, there was an outlet in the bathroom and one in the bedroom for the TV. We had adequate room with a sofa bed, mini refrig and large closet. Friendly staff and simple breakfast which was more than enough with good coffee. Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Rude manager and dark hotel..”
Reviews.Author: Jo S
Reviews.Content: On checking-in, an angry-looking manager (morning shift) not even had a look at us : " I am reading...YOU wait." . After 5-10 minutes, raised his voice " Who is first ? " The lobby in tiny and everything is dark. Room had enough watts light to move around, cannot read in nighttime. There are NO electric plugs in the room !! and the hotel offered free internet. Hotel smells cigarette smoking. Once the windows are closed, not much noises from the street. On checking-out, the same manager yelled : " YOU pay now, and you must give me the hotel key before you forget.." The taxi recommended by the hotel was late and no explanations from him, who again, was reading ! Close to Vatican, but who needs to be bullied when on vacation ? Major monuments to be seen are the other side of the river. The pictures on the net are better than reality.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what I expected”
Reviews.Author: aileronguy
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel last minute as I was searching for 2 separate rooms in Rome for 2 couples (my wife and I and another couple), but had a hard time finding available and low price in a single hotel. This hotel has a junior suit which has a bedroom separate from the living room with a hide a bed couch for EURO 288. This arrangement worked out except the hide a bed couch was not all that comfortable which we expected. The room over all was very large as was the bathroom. However we were left a little disappointed by the bland decor, overall shabbiness of the hotel, and sparse breakfast. Also, unfortunately our room was really close to the breakfast area so we were woke up by the staff setting up in the morning, but were able to go right back to sleep. One small last complaint, upon check out we were informed for the first time that there was a Euro2 per person “city tax” charge added to our bill. Nothing to get to excited about, but nothing was mentioned when I booked the room through the hotels website nor at check in so thought that was a little inconsiderate. Other than that the staff was helpful and friendly. Given this, the hotel served our need and at Euro144 per couple was not that bad of a deal. However I would have been greatly disappointed if I had booked this for just my wife and I expecting a higher end splurge hotel which we sometimes like to do.

Reviews.Title: “a little worn down but near the bus stop”
Reviews.Author: sugartee
Reviews.Content: The price of the hotel is reasonable but I think someone has to check the rooms to make sure things in the room work properly. We stayed there about 3 years ago.The breakfast was simple, as in most of Italy but was good enough, (coffee was excellent).The rooms served their purpose but the pictures on the net were better than the actual. We had 3 rooms. In 1 room the safe was totally detached so you could bring it with you, the 2nd room had the safe anchored to the wooden top but the wooden top was not attached to the drawers so you could bring that along too.All in all you could find better places but you could also find worse.

Reviews.Title: “It was a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: linkdaniel
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for Rome, it was very comfortable place to stay in and the stuff was amazing, would recommend this hotel to anybody looking to visit such a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rbird
Reviews.Content: We stayed in July 2011 one night before a cruise. Nice location--easy walk to Spanish steps and Piazza Navona and Forum, and also to the Vatican. Nice quiet location. Our room was very large and cool. It is a small hotel, and nothing fancy, but was reasonably priced. Decent breakfast. We would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Mipa22
Reviews.Content: the hotel was centrally located and the staff was extremely helpful. Good size room with air conditioning. Most hotels in Rome do not have a/c in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Super Friendly staff, nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: lalalatracy
Reviews.Content: Our group had 6 rooms & each room was different size ranging from ok size to massive, some rooms have sofas others don't, the aircon in the bigger rooms are not really sufficient & in the smaller rooms it's really cold! But it's not really a problem as we didn't spend much time in the rooms. My room had no plugs apart from 1 in the ceiling of the bathroom, so we had to charge MacBooks,iPhones,cameras all in the bathroom, so bring a multi-plug, internet is free. Amenities include shampoo& bathwash in one, shower cap, 2 soap & shoe shine, so bring your toiletries! My bathroom just barely fitted 2 ppl in, but its really big in other rooms! Breakfast is perfect, nothing greasy & heavy, croissants, ham, cheeses, fruits etc. Hotel is located away from the main part so it's nice & quite but only a really short walk to town & Vatican, there are some nice restaurants just across the rd & a super mkt 10mins walk away (we walk slow!!) The service here is 5stars! Any issues are dealt with without any hassle, they were happy to print our boarding passes & recommended us to some nice restaurants. Def would stay here again if I return to Rome, good price & nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “central rome”
Reviews.Author: joostinubud
Reviews.Content: fantastic central spot... over the tiber river so close to pantheon/plaza navona... efficient room and clean bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Central, met our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Sweden081
Reviews.Content: We had read all the reviews about this hotel and were a bit nervous when booking it. We couldn't have been more wrong. The hotel is a 3 star hotel, no more, no less - which is hard to find in Rome. We stayed for four nights and the hotel was just what we needed. We booked the standard double room and it was sufficient enough for our needs. If you want a room to spend a lot of time in then you should probably choose another hotel. But if you're aiming to explore the city and be on the go a lot then this hotel is perfect. It's 1 min away from the flight bus station and close walking distance to both the Vatican and the Spanish Steps. Breakfast was included in our price and was sufficient enough to give you a good start, don't expect anything fancy though - you'll be served a typical european continental breakfast. Toast, cheese, ham, variety of crossiants, cornflakes etc. The staff was very helpful and spoke good english. The room was cleaned everyday. The hotel also had free internet. The only thing that annoyed us about the hotel was that it wasn't very soundproof at all. You could hear everything going on in the hallway, which was really annoying in the morning (although a good wake-up clock).

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: babe66
Reviews.Content: Would recommend this hotel as it was very near to the vatican etc. Very clean with good facilities in the room. Bathroom had both bath and shower facilities. Staff were also very helpful. It was very hot when we stayed there and the air conditioning in the bedrooms was wonderful. Everything was in good working order and condition in the rooms and the hotel was priced about right for its location. Overall - nothing to complain about and I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. great location”
Reviews.Author: gertygreen
Reviews.Content: Staff helpful and friendly, room large with Super King Size comfortable bed, 2 chairs, table and sofa, air conditioning, in room safe and plenty of storage space. Bathroom large with good selection of toiletries. Buffet breakfast fine with outdoor eating area as well as breakfast room. (NB for those who complain about no hot food, continental breakfast does not usually include it.) Excellent location in Prati. On a main bus route to Termini Station which went through City Centre and near many of main sites. 10 minutes walk from Castel Sant' Angelo, 20 from Vatican, 15 from Piazza Navona and about 35 from Colosseum. Piazza Cavour about 2 minutes away with lots of places to eat in the streets leading off from the Piazza. Can recommend Trattoria Palazzaccio

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: DayTripperLDN
Reviews.Content: In Rome it is not that easy to find an good hotel that it is not too expensive, well located, with large and clean rooms. Hotel Diplomatic has all these characteristics. Don't expect a warm and charming place, it is not a "romantic" hotel but it is the perfect base to visit Rome and a good place to sleep comfortably after a busy day (tourist or business). Air conditioning is fine and the double glazed windows isolate from the traffic of the street. (however better to ask a room facing the internal courtyard). Free WiFi is a nice plus.

Reviews.Title: “bargain hotel in superb location!!!”
Reviews.Author: tattyteddy73
Reviews.Content: Was a little worried about what to expect to begin with as we got such a great deal for this hotel. I was pleasantly surprised on arrival to find a very spacious room with really comfy double bed, tv, 2 bed settees, lovely bathroom with great shower, deep bath lots of vanity area around basin. loo and bidet. Mini bar has enough space to fit any wine of nibbles you buy yourself too. Continental breakfast what you would expect it to be - delicious coffee. Restaurant staff a little unhappy looking. Staff on reception are exceptionally helpful and courteous. Only downside is there is no parking with the hotel, nearby parking is 35 euro per day! (however we would never bother hiring a car next time as buses and trams are so cheap and regular) Room 205 had no view other than windows of other rooms. Excellent location, really close to St Peters, Vatican museums, spanish steps, trevi fountain Cant wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel within easy walking distance of everything.”
Reviews.Author: pbussey
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two weeks in Rome with the Hotel Diplomatic as our home base and it was terrific. The room was clean, and recently updated; the bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was really nice. The continental breakfast was fine; but the coffee was great. The breakfast wait-staff were charming, the front desk personnel were friendly and helpful --- I would recommend it without hesitation. And, given the chance, I'd stay there again. Room 105 loves you guys, hope to come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Location excellent, rooms very good.”
Reviews.Author: Bren60
Reviews.Content: This hotel was hard to find but a good location for sight seeing, just behind the Castle Sant Angelo and a short walk to St Peters Sq. And Vatican Museums. Older style comfort, good quality furnishings and fittings, lovely deep bath with lots of hot water! Quiet and comfortable sleep. Breakfast a bit basic-cappuccini best request for coffee. Would be improved if tea/coffee making facilities were available in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Staff nice, Hotel noisy, Medical Assistance dog had to pay”
Reviews.Author: Repligator
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel now for the 4th time. I always request a room off the street and have benn accomodated. During this stay the woman manager emphatically said the street is not nosiy and " no one has ever complained." I love when they say they never heard this. I had three nights in a hot room- no A/C. If you open the window there was no way you could sleep for all the noise. The bus stop is directly in front of the hotel and the buses run until 3 AM. On the other hand the staff at the hotel is wonderful, personalbe and very helpful. I traveled with a Medical Assistance dog and they made me pay 20E for each nights stay even though I was told by the Italien Toursit Board that disabled people are given the same benefits in Italy as the US. no other hotel in Italy - and I was in 5 others charged me for the dog.

Reviews.Title: “Hardest bed I have ever felt!”
Reviews.Author: LMcKee
Reviews.Content: Location was great, no complaints there. Small rooms, bad view, nice bathroom w hair dryer, etc. The bed was the hardest bed I have ever experienced. It was literally like a rock. It will never need to be replaced!! A SLAB ! Teeny tiny elevator...breakfast was a C-. Needed more variety, and we were there 5 days, and nothing changed. Kind of skimpy selection of nothing. Wait staff never smiled, seemed angry. Maid started fussing every morning right outside our door, so we knew it was 6:30 am. The daytime temps were in the upper 40s low 50's and the rooms were extremely WARM. We asked if it could be adjusted, and they said, NO, its controlled by the city....oh well, we opened the window. There was a dirty refrigerator in our room, with some seedy looking items, and it was not hooked up. There was a safe which is a convenience. Front desk men, were not the friendliest people, sometimes downright rude. Free Wi FI was nice. Would not recommend this to my friends, but we made the best of it. There must be somewhere worse in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms too tiny, and service bad!”
Reviews.Author: jennifer5518
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I arrived at The Diplomatic Hotel and was not greeted very friendly by front desk staff. By the way, front desk consists of a small desk. I was told by my travel agent that this was a good hotel, and I requested a King size bed. Upon arrival we got a room that was so tiny, I would swear that they split up one large room and made up several smaller rooms out of the one. And the bed was not a king size bed, it was a large twin. I went back to the desk and demanded we get what we paid for. They did comply, and gave us a slighter larger room with a double bed, STILL NO KING. Then their buffet breakfast, IS NO BUFFET. They only have cold cereal, rolls, and salami and cheese. And the wait staff women, obviously hate americans. I would never stay there again. Oh, and by the way, the hotel had a sewer smell the entire time. Gross.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Diplomatic - Excellent value/location”
Reviews.Author: Elaine186364
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Hotel Diplomatic, Rome for five nights in March 2011. The staff were friendly, the location was excellent. We were able to walk to all the sights. Breakfast was plentiful. free safe in the room and a hair-drier. Our only disappointment was that there wasn't a coffee/tea maker in the room!! This would have made this hotel PERFECT.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveller186394
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful service, excellent clean rooms and you can't beat the location of this hotel. For a Hotel so close to all the sights it is nice and quiet and th breakfast veranda is lovely. I would thoroughly recommend it and good value as well.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in great position”
Reviews.Author: fairo
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews I was expecting much more. Very small dark room, tiny bathroom with a poor shower. Breakfast was nothing special, no hot food. However , hotel is ideaaly situated for walking to any of the major sights. Would be reluctant to stay again.If you need airport transfers, we used Rome Pickup and found them very reliable and cheap.Our flight was 2 hrs late and they waited for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and an enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: mythologies123
Reviews.Content: I found the reviews for the hotel helpful and I’m pleased I booked the Diplomatic. It’s about an hour from the airport. I stayed there on my own and felt safe - the staff were friendly and helpful. There’s no kettle and you may want to take your own pillow. However, an enjoyable stay, clean, good breakfast and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jrp811
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location, we walked everywhere. Room was clean and comfortable. Staff isn't the friendliest/most helpful we've ever experienced but it didn't put a damper on our trip. Breakfast was sufficient and filling enough to get us to lunch. I'd recommend this hotel if you're looking for a clean, no frills place to stay in Rome. Take the airport shuttle to the airport and you'll save a lot of $$. It's right down the street from the hotel (it took us awhile to find it but it was closer than we thought). Would stay here again if ever go back to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great value - wonderful location and service!”
Reviews.Author: Sweetjh3
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at hotel diplomatic, and loved it! We walked everywhere in Rome, so the location of the hotel, especially for the price, was great. It is a 15 minute walk to the Vatican, 5 minutes to the Spanish steps and piazza del popolo, and about 30 minutes to the Colosseum. They had great service at the hotel - when we arrived, Stefano checked us in, and was a joy to chat with while we were there. He helped us with our Italian (our language skills were sorely lacking!), and gave us local recommendations. Hotel Diplomatic also has breakfast every morning, and the staff is pleasant. I enjoyed my cappuccino every morning :-) The standard rooms are small but well kept, and the shower is great. It was quiet, which was really nice. We took a trip to Florence while we were in Italy, and when we returned to Rome for our last night, we stayed in a large room at hotel diplomatic, and it

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: RonGHaifa
Reviews.Content: Hotel Diplomatic is located within walking distance to all of the historic sites. There are buses right outside the hotel and the Metro is a 10 minute walk away for any longer distances. We had a quiet room at the back of the hotel and our sheets were changed in the middle of our eight night stay. Room kept very clean and bathroom very functional with a shower, bath, bidet, and a hair dryer. Soap and shampoo added every day. The breakfast was adequate to start your day but no hot food except coffee and tea. The internet is Wi-Fi and provided free for i hour intervals. To extend for additional time you must go down to the front desk. Overall you get good value for your money. We would stay there again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, terrible bed!”
Reviews.Author: lorrainelowe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Walk a few minutes in one direction and you're across the river and into the main shopping district. A bit further on and you're at the Spanish Steps. Walk in the other direction and you're at the Vatican and St. Peter's Basilica. You can literally walk everywhere from this location. However the bed in the room was so uncomfortable, hard mattress and very flat pillows. The room in general was not great, the bathroom was very pokey. The breakfast was good however (much better than my previous experience with Roman breakfasts!) and the service was decent (reception checked us in for our flight etc). One tip, do not book a taxi to the airport through the hotel!! Just go out on the street and get one, much cheaper!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: aelovesbeach
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and our room was facing the street which was noisy at times. The walls were thin so you can hear other tvs and conversations. The bed was hard w/very poor pillows. I would advise brining your own. The bathroom was decent. The location was excellent since it was close walking distance to the spanish steps (15 min), Trevi fountain (15 min), Vatican (20 min) and short bus ride to the Colleseum which you can catch in front of the hotel. we took the Bus shuttle from the airport which dropped us off at the piazza cavour one block from the hotel. it was 8 Euro pp which was very good. We were walking distance from piazza novana where we found some excellent restaurants on the side streets from the plaza. def have the tartufo from here. Excellent! There was not internet access from the room that was free. The breakfast was ok with bread, croissant, cereal, ham, salami, cheese, yogurt, canned fruit. The staff was not detailed in explaining directions.

Reviews.Title: “definately recommended !”
Reviews.Author: MrsOWestMids
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 day night stay at the hotel, booked based on TA reviews. We had a very pleasant stay . Rooms were clean, bathrooms better than expected with decent sized bath. Impressive continental breakfast served by pleasant staff. We stayed in room 407, a twin overlooking back of hotel ( no view ) & my friends stayed in a much bigger 404 ( 405 looked larger too ) with a side view. We all agreed that this hotel is an excellent choice in Rome - far enough from the busy, noisy centre, but an easy walk to all the main attractions. One of the tour buses has a stop right outside the entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: pplumlee
Reviews.Content: Best location to sightsee and stroll around Rome. Walking distance to Vatican, Panthenon, Colussem, and Trevi Fountain. Close to river nightlife and great restaurants. Nice, clean rooms. Very nice and helpful staff, internet access and great morning breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and good location”
Reviews.Author: AustraliansOnTour12
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent, a 20 minute walk to the Vatican, an easy bus ride from the front of the hotel to the Colleseum and trendy Trastevere. The nearest Metro station was a 15 minute walk. We stayed in the double room with ensuite. It was very spacious and clean. Wifi was available in the room at an extra cost, this should be included in the cost of the room for the price you pay. Breakfast provided a good range. The staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected !!”
Reviews.Author: Davvo123
Reviews.Content: Spent (too) many hours looking for a suitable hotel in Rome. Initally thought a centrally located hotel would be better to see the sights. However, the budget priced hotels appear to be in the Termini area. Had a look at this area when there and really glad we did not choose this area. If you like noise,bizz and generally 'tatty' surroundings this is the place to be!. The Hotel Diplomatic is located on the opposite bank of city center, near the Vatican. It is about a 10 minute stroll to the Spanish steps. The beauty of the hotel location is that it is out of the tourist areas but easily accessable for all attractions. The furthest is the Colloseum which is approx 20mins by bus from outside the hotel. Bus tickets are purchased from the cafe/tobacconist at the stop for 1 euro each. They must be time stamped on the bus and this allows 75 mins travel. The standard of the hotel was more than adeqate. We booked a double room and were very pleased with a front facing room with small balcony. I would suggest requesting this if possible as rear rooms would look into other buildings.Our room was small but very well appointed. Aircon worked! Clean laundry. LCD TV (though not a good selection of cannels!). Bathroon was all marble with wet shower. A small reception with friendly staff, lift to all floors,internet avilable at 1 euro for 1hr. Breakfast served in pleasant surroundings looking on to patio area with tables & chairs (although surrounded by high buildings). Buffet breakfast which was more than expected. Cereal, meat, cheese, rolls, bread ( & toaster), fruit cocktail,youghurts, croissants, tea, coffee etc. Fill up and this keeps you going for most of the day. There are a number of restaurants situated locally. Note; there is a Fiumicino airport bus stop in Piazza Cavour 50yds from the hotel running every hour charging 8 euros p.p. We used it and it works! All in all a very good experience and I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone looking for decent quality at a fair price in a pleasant location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, awful customer service”
Reviews.Author: salyse530
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the first leg of our three week honeymoon in Europe. And, as a note, I would recommend this hotel simply because the room was clean and it was very close to everything without being incredibly expensive. That being said, when we arrived the front desk staff was curt and unhelpful. We had just finished an at least twelve hour trip and though we were exhausted we wanted to start sight seeing. We asked the front desk staff what would be the best way to get to the Old Synagogue, and wanted to walk. When it appeared that he did not know what we were talking about we gave him the address we were looking for. We were told it was way too far to walk. We told him that we were okay walking a couple of miles, it was a beautiful day and we had been on a plane for a long time. He basically refused to give us any directions. So, we just left, and after walking around for a couple of hours we found what we were looking for. On the second day we asked how to go about getting onto the internet. We were given a code and went up to the consoles. The code did not work. We went down to the front desk and were told that we did not put it in right. - though he never asked how we entered it. He reprinted the code, but this time it was illegible. When I asked if he could discern what the last number or two were he looked at me and rolled his eyes. We went upstairs to try to enter the code again and it still was not working. So, we went back downstairs and told him it still was not working. At this point he got rude and snippy and told us that we obviously didn't know what we were doing. I told him exactly how we were putting the code into the computer and asked him if that were correct to which I got another roll of his eyes. At this point he gave us another code and we tried it again. When it STILL didn't work I went downstairs told him it didn't work and said that we wanted our money back - which he obliged. However, he repeatedly stated that we must have been doing something wrong with the code and each piece of paper was incredibly difficult to read as there was no ink in the printer. The next morning my husband asked about the internet service and we were informed that it was down and had been down since yesterday. Aha we thought. Anyway, some of the other front desk staff were "okay" but in general the customer service was quite lacking in this establishment. I was very disappointed as I had read about the hotel on Trip Advisor before we booked, and had not read this in any of the reviews. All in all it was a great location, front staff was awful (and was unable to give us any recommendations for dinner), and room was clean but small with an uncomfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “No A/C”
Reviews.Author: amschitaly
Reviews.Content: We arrived early because our flight landed at 7am. I advise against this. Take a later flight to arrive later so you can crash in your room. They had us wait downstairs for two hours while we waited for a room to be ready. When I tried to get a cup of coffee from the leftover breakfast buffet, they charged me 8 Euro. Annoying but I guess the lesson is always ask. Our room had no A/C. They told us to give it time to cool down, so like idiots, we took a nap in the scorching heat. A few hours later, they were refusing to move us until we put up a fight. Sadly, my mom was now officially suffering heat stroke. The only plus of this hotel was the inexpensive internet. It was the last time for the next three weeks that I got a good signal.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Hemstal
Reviews.Content: I've been to Rome on business dozens of times and unless i stayed at an international brand hotel, I've always found Rome hotel rooms small and a rip-off. This hotel is an exception. It is well placed for sight-seeing, staff are helpful with local restaurant choices and the 2 rooms we were given were spacious with a small balcony with a view. 'Best bang for the buck' I've had for years while travelling to Rome, well done to Hotel Diplomatic, I hope they do not raise their prices.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Laurem29
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of this hotel. The bus stops right outside the door but you can walk to everything. It's closest to the Vatican and a short walk (15 min) to all the shops, Trevi fountain, Piazza Navona....30 min walk to the Colosseum... The rooms were small but comfortable and they definitely had the biggest bathroom we had on our trip in Europe. The AC is just cool enough to not be sweating but not cold. The beds are comfortable. The staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast was fine, pastries and coffee...great little restaurant around the corner, Ristorante Roma. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “great location to all the sites”
Reviews.Author: jumpinhorsedad
Reviews.Content: can't beat the location of this hotel. the sightseeing tourist bus stops right outside the door. great little cafe / bars right across the street from the hotel. vatican around the corner (and up the road) outdoor bizarre / flea market within 5 blocks along the river. high end fashion shops and other shopping right across the bridge. really good. the hotel is a 3 star. but reasonable and fair frontend staff. its italy and you do have be careful of the tourist rip off but seemed easy to work with. rooms are fair size. bathroom was clean and everything worked. hard to really complain all things considered. although the area is busy during the day the night seemed quite quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great breakfast, wonderful hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: Heidi1950
Reviews.Content: The hotel doesn't look like much from the outside, but it's very nice inside. It's a typcial european hotel with very small elevators and a tiny lobby, but the rooms were a very good size..This hotel is within walking distance of the Vatican, and we were able to travel by foot to every site in Rome from the hotel The front desk staff is so friendly and helpful and we enjoyed getting to know them. The breakfast was great and the best part was the terrific location. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PoorestTourists
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect hotel in Rome. It is located on the Vatican side of the river which runs through the middle of Rome. As a result, the prices are cheaper than some hotels on the downtown Rome side of the river. But there are a bunch of pedestrian bridges crossing the river and it is so convenient to get to any sights in Rome. The furthest attraction is the Colosseum, which is only a 20-30 minute walk, and the Vatican is quite close. For most hotels in Rome it wouldn't be possible to walk to the Vatican, but this one is located in the middle of everything! We didn't take the metro once except to and from the airport. We walked everywhere else to all of the tourist attractions, and we went in the winter, so if we could walk it, you can walk it! Rome is an expensive city, but we found the rates at this hotel to be very reasonable. The rate includes free breakfast which was standard and had delicious pastries. The service at the hotel was always very nice. Our room itself was fairly small, but not tiny. The bed was quite hard, but we slept fine. We were pleased to be able to find a non-smoking room. One tip: the transportation to and from the airport is so ridiculously expensive. We discovered a bus that runs for only 8 euros and stops right around the corner from this hotel at Piazza Cavour--it is called sitbusshuttle (sitbusshuttle.it)--you buy your tickets on board and it is a much better transportation option than the Leonardo express train. Overall, we can't recommend this hotel enough. The location was so perfect that we would never consider staying anywhere else in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Diplomatic!!! Best location and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: mitzid66
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved the Diplomatic! Stayed Nov 7-16, 2009. The staff was wonderful. Especially Luca (sp?) Our room was basic, but great! Bathroom had plenty of room. Everything always clean when we got back every day. I think we were in 206. Windows opened onto rooftops, and was very quiet. We would leave the windows open all evening, and never heard a thing. Two huge closets to hang our clothes and store extras. Breakfast each day was great. Pastries, meats, cheese and Nutella! Best coffee in a hotel - ever! And the ladies who attended in the breakfast room were very sweet. On the day we were to visit the Vatican museums, I realized I had not printed off the correct attachment before I left home. We dashed back into the hotel, and asked Luca if I could get on the internet right away as I didn't have a printout. Instead of having us get all hooked up to the hotel internet, he hopped right on his computer to help me. Between the two of us, and getting to my email, he had what I needed printed out in less then 2 minutes. And we were off to the Vatican with no worries!! He is the best! And such a super person all around! All of the front desk staff were friendly and helpful with directions, questions, calling cabs, etc. Even though it is on the "Vatican side" of the river, we were still in Piazza Navona in 10 minutes by walking every evening. A couple of great cafes are outside the door in either direction. Totally loved the location/neighborhood. If this had been in warm weather, we would have spent time sitting in the little outdoor area outside the breakfast room. I know it would be lovely in warmer tempatures. Will definately be back again in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Clean near hotel near attractions.”
Reviews.Author: Sat1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights booked via Expedia in their standard room. We were given room 105 which was on the first floor near the breakfast room. Room was clean with a two single beds joined together. The mattress was completely sunken in where previous guests had slept which made lying down feel quite uncomfortable. The toilet seat in the bathroom was very loose. Not sure if I should be grateful for having one because most bars/restaurants in Rome were missing them. Breakfast was nice 6:30am-10:30 with rolls, croissants, cereals, yogurts and cheeses and ham. Get there early because after 9:15am things run out and you’re only left with cereals and toast. From FCO airport we were going to take the train for 11 euro per person to Termini but opted to take the mini bus service offered by the information desk near the train platform for 15 euro/person. Found it a little odd that they wrote 7euro on the front main of the receipt and 30euro on the back. Once at the hotel your very central to everything and will walk mostly the main sights. 87 bus outside the hotel takes you directly to the coliseum if you don’t want to walk or back. On our return journey to the airport the hotel reception recommended their airport drop off service for 45 euros for 1-3 people as the nearest metro is 10 blocks away. We were told that taking normal suitcases onboard busses was not allowed but when we checked with tourist information they confirmed that this was indeed rubbish. So we opted to take the number 70 bus to termini which stopped about 1 block away. You can’t buy the ticket on this bus so buy it before hand. Next trying to buy a Leonardo Express ticket was a bit deceptive because on the train platform the machine only seemed to support Italian language but one guy approached us I tried to sell us his tickets for the same price, pretending he had vocal cord problems. Hesitant at first, I agreed as I watched others buy tickets from him and the train was due to depart in a couple of minutes. He validated the ticket for me but afterwards I noticed that the ticket had a timestamp of 9:15 when I was indeed travelling around 4:52pm. Thought we had got ripped off I reluctantly got onboard and handed the ticket to the inspector. He seemed to hesitate but then just stamped the ticket as valid. Not sure if he saw we had been had and as gesture of good will never said anything or the ticket was indeed valid. Phew! Rome is very expensive with the poor exchange rate to the £. Can of coke can cost up to 5 euros in some places. If you’re interested in buying those fake handbags being sold near some of the tourist attractions then we managed to pick then up for 12-14 euros when the initial price quoted was 45 euro. Most people were happy with paying 25 euro thinking they had got a good discount. Enjoy...

Reviews.Title: “Great location - walked everywhere.”
Reviews.Author: EllenYorkshire
Reviews.Content: I was so glad to stay at the Diplomatic. Walking in Rome is the way to see the city - unexpected encounters with history all the time. It is close to the river and the wonderful recently restored Ara Pacis. Staff were great, room a refuge after tramping about!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great price, thin walls”
Reviews.Author: mankinduk
Reviews.Content: I don't know how it all works but we were on the top floor and as such, had a balcony looking out onto the street. From what I could work out, only about half the rooms have these balconies. So that was a definite plus. However, because of various factors, you can only actually see anything if you are standing up so no sitting on the balcony with a glass of wine, enjoying the view. Also, even from up on the 5th floor with the windows and shutters shut, there was still plenty of noise from the traffic below during the night. Nothing that bothered me but I imagine if you were lower down, it might be more of a problem. No, what bothered me more was the extremely thin walls. If there was someone in the room next to you, you knew about it. I think it was perhaps the air conditioning system too, all the rooms connected, meaning that if someone spoke in the room next to you, you could hear it pretty clearly where you were. Again, not normally a problem but on our first night our neighbours were up way into the small hours and not overly concerned with how or if their fellow neighbours were sleeping after a long day of travel. Not the hotel's fault per se, but in a different hotel it wouldn't have been such an issue. And if our stay had more overlapped with the same people it may have been a more serious issue for us. It does remain hypothetical because they weren't there for the rest of our stay and did enjoy our stay overall. To get on a more positive note....the complimentary breakfast was pretty good, the patio as I mentioned is great if you get one, the staff were fairly friendly, the rooms were kept spotless, *all* the main attractions were within 30 minutes walking distance tops (most of them less), great value for money and the Rome 110Open tourist bus stops literally outside the front door. Nothing particularly fancy about the hotel but for the price and location, there can't be many better out there in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel”
Reviews.Author: KentStompy
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a perfect location. All sights were well within walking distance, the furthest we had to walk was the colosseum which was a 30 minute slow walk. Would highly recommend this hotel for anyone travelling to Rome. Rooms were clean and the staff were more then helpful and spoke very good English.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, clean, and very good service”
Reviews.Author: NorwegianTraveler1
Reviews.Content: I originally book a hotel room in the Ara Pacis hotel just opposite of the Hotel Diplomatic, but after reading some terrible reviews I changed my reservation to this hotel. And I´m glad I did. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful, they can help you with anything. The rooms are decent sized, and very clean (which is difficult to find in Rome). The location is perfect. It will take you no more than 10 min to reach all the main sights in rome, except the colosseum which is around 20 min away. No need for taxi to go anywhere downtown. But be sure to book a pick-up with the hotel. We took a taxi from Fiumucino to the hotel, total cost 75 euro. Only to learn that if we booked it through the hotel it would´ve been 45.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: UNCfanVal
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Hotel Diplomatic. From the very start it was nothing but excellent. Our flight from the States got in before 9 and we were at the hotel by 10am. Our room was not ready so they stored our bags for us. We did some sightseeing nearby and came back an hour later. Our room was ready and the bags had already been brought up. The room was very good size even for US standards. There were 3 of us and the room was actually a quad. There was a double bed and 2 sofas and one was made up into a bed. There was actually a wall divide between the beds so as to make almost 2 rooms. The air conditioning was adequate. It made the room cool, but not as cool as we would like in the States. It was 100 everyday we were there and it cooled the room down enough to make it comfortable. The breakfast in the morning was your typical European breakfast with cereal and breads. The hotel staff was great. They remembered us every time we came and left and would help us with anything we needed. Our flight to Athens was not until the evening and they stored our luggage during the day for us. They even booked a taxi to the airport for us which was nice b/c it was a Mercedes and air conditioned. On the 1st floor near the breakfast room is a computer you can use to check email and other things. The location could not be better. It is a 5 minute walk to Castle San Angelo and the Vatican. It is about 5-10 minutes across the bridge to all the main sites. There is never a need for a cab or bus. There is also an ATM right next door which was very convenient. It is close to the Vatican stop for the hop on hop off sightseeing tour. I would definitely stay at this hotel again the next time I came to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Book at your own risk!!!”
Reviews.Author: mm137
Reviews.Content: The hotel has become a popular stay, so they over book. Thats what happened to us. They moved us to a shaddy nieghborhood by the train station to their sister hotel. It was located next to a strip club and the hotel was under construction from 7am to 4pm. I explained that I did not want to stay at this hotel and they gave me a take it or leave it attitude. They know your not going to waste your time walking from hotel to hotel looking for a room. Take this as a warning not to be stuck in Italy at a sleezy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Diplomatic: another excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: lauraloop
Reviews.Content: I returned to the Hotel Diplomatic for a three-night stay last week - my second time at this hotel. The venue is excellent - just a 10 minute walk across the river to the Spanish Steps and the centre of town, plus a lovely 5-10 minute walk along the river to the Castel Sant'Angelo and St Peters. The hotel itself is exactly what I was looking for in a good three star hotel, if not more. The rooms were clean, the beds comfortable, the bathroom a good size and the mini-bar is the type of small fridge which you can put your own water / wine in. The wardrobe is a good size and there are real hangers which you can actually remove from the wardrobe - result! Some people have complained about the air conditioning, and having just spent four days in Rome when it was 42 degrees, I agree that it's not the best air-con system but it's perfectly adequate. If I can survive in these temperatures then I'm sure everyone else can. Just keep the shutters down during the day and keep the air con up and the room will be a lovely temperature at the end of the day. On a positive note, the fact that the air-con is not heavy duty means that you don't wake up in the middle of the night with a dry, scratchy throat. The complimentary breakfast is simple but perfectly good - especially the ciambellone - with a selection of breads, pastries, cheeses, hams, yoghurts, fruit, cereals and hot and cold drinks. I expecially like having breakfast outdoors on the terrace under the canopies - a lovely way to start the day. The staff is also excellent - very friendly, remembered our names, and booked a car for us for our return journey to the airport. At only 5 euros more than a standard taxi, it was nice to have a lovely air-conditioned mercedes to give us a relaxing return journey - I would definitely recommend you take up this service. The hotel is very reasonably priced at approx £60-70 per night (particularly when you consider that it includes breakfast) so I would totally recommend this hotel to everyone - I am delighted with it and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good rooms, good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Jeff_and_Dianne
Reviews.Content: This is a basic, no frills hotel. The location is good for walking to the Rome highlights, however a little difficult to initially get to as it is likely too far a walk from the Termini train station. A taxi from the Termini will rob you blind. Take a city bus for 1 EU from the train station or maybe use a shuttle from the Rome airport. The rooms and ensuite are fine, the included continental breakfast is good (tea, coffee, fruit juice, yougurt, toast, jam, pastries, canned fruit). On the downside, there is no air conditioning in the rooms and no internet available. Good value for the money at a relatively central location.

Reviews.Title: “Good as a basis”
Reviews.Author: HaakonN
Reviews.Content: My wife planned this trip so I am writing the reviews ;-) The hotel was nothing special but I mean it in a good way. It was close to the centre but not loud, the rooms were small but clean, the price was acceptable. Iwould tell my friends to stay here if they are not looking for the ultimate romantic weekend.

Reviews.Title: “My fourth stay at Hotel Diplomatic.”
Reviews.Author: Wewant2seetheworld
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth stay at Hotel Diplomatic, and it was just as good as the first. On my first trip to Rome back in 1997, while walking through the airport on my arrival, a guy gave me a piece of paper as I walked past him and said, "If you need a good hotel try this one". Well, I put the paper in my pocket and kept walking. When I got to the hotel that I was staying in, (Holiday Inn), I was very disappointed and after one night there I decided to try another hotel. So I found the hotel flyer that the guy at the airport had given me and called Hotel Diplomatic. The price was way less than I was paying at the Holiday Inn, so I decided to give it a try. Everyone was so nice and helpful. I fell in love with the hotel due to the location and how convenient it was to everything, not to mention the price. The rooms are a nice size for Europe, even though the bathrooms are a little on the small side. So here I am twelve years later and still enjoying Hotel Diplomatic's quaint coziness. The breakfast is always very good also. As always I still recomend this nice little hotel for great value and comfort in Rome. I sure am glad I didn't just throw that flyer in the trash at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value...Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: Francorsi
Reviews.Content: We were a bit worried when we saw the entrance which is very small and unassuming, but the rooms were just great. Very tasteful and elegant old world decor and lovely bathrooms. The breakfast too was super and the service staff so friendly at all times. The location saved us a bunch on transport as we could walk to almost every good tourist spot in Rome...The Piazza di Popolo, Il Vittoriale, la Fontana di Trevi, Piazza Navona, Il Vaticano & San Pietro, The Pantheon and the Tiber river which is just a 100 meters down from the hotel. Piazza Cavour where the hotel is located houses the Supreme Court..a beautiful building and has a huge bus station right there...Frankly the hotel is close to restaurants, banks shopping...you name it. So we shall definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Late-Travellers
Reviews.Content: Hotel had been recomended by friends so we were reasonably confident that it would be ok. It was much better than ok. We had a king size bed in a large room on the second floor. Room had a large sofa, table and chair. Mini bar was well stocked and very reasonably priced. The bathroom had a good supply of shampoos etc and was restocked every day.Towels were changed and the room was obviously cleaned daily. Althoug the room was on the front of the hotel the traffic noise was not a problem. We were aware of the traffic early morning but it was not really disturbing. Breakfast was adequate with a selection of cereals, danish, juice and toast. Tea and coffee was in good supply and was hot, something lacking in many other hotels. The main attraction for us was the location - it is perfect. It is 15 minutes walk to the Vatican area and 10 minutes to the main town centre, Spanish steps area. The reception staff and breakfast room staff all spoke perfect English and were helpful with directions and ordering taxis. We have already recomended this hotel to family and friends and hope to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: GunnytgNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Diplomatic for 3 nights when we arrived, then we returned after touring the Naples area. The hotel entrance is nothing to brag about. Perhaps a lively color on the walls, some colorful art, or some plants would make it appear more appealing. The room was quite spartan but a nice size and clean. The shower was excellent. The bed (king) adequate considering my husband suffers from a bad back. The rooms facing the street could be a little noisy as the hotel is situated on a busy street. The interior rooms are much quiter. The location centrally located to all the attractions and the city tour bus stop was just outside the door. Breakfast could have been a little more elaborate, but sufficed. After pricing many hotels, I would say for Rome this was good. We would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: CAFamilyOf5
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an amazing value for the money. Good location, very near the St. Angelo Bridge, with upscale rooms with marble bathrooms and a tub! Breakfast was also a bit more generous than we experienced at other, more expensive, hotels in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: rachel1982
Reviews.Content: Having read a number of mixed reviews on the Hotel Diplomatic I had my concerns but decided to keep an open mind and I wasn't disappointed. The hotels location has to be its main feature, nearly all of the main sights are within walking distance and for those that aren't a bus stop is conveniently situated outside the hotel entrance! We arrived early (11:30 ish) and so in fairness hadn't expected to be able to check in. The reception desk were extremely helpful and allowed us to store our luggage until the rooms were ready. We were told that there would be about a 20min wait and so we decided to take a walk around to get our bearings. The receptionist very kindly provided us with a map and the address of the hotel so that we would be able to relocate it! We had a twin room (106) both the room and the ensuite were much larger than expected. The room itself came equipped with a stocked mini bar (prices same as in the local shops) TV (although only CNN is in English!) and possibly the best air conditioning ever experienced ! (something much appreciated in the 35 degree August heat) Breakfast was good consisting of toast, cereals, pastries, yoghurts and fruit. The rooms were made up daily and the towels were changed at the same time. After about 5pm the road outside is empty and so you experience no disturbance from the traffic. We stayed 4 nights and had a very enjoyable stay I couldn't find fault in anything. I would definitly recommend the Hotel Diplomatic. Top Tips- * Pre book excursions to the Vatican/Colosseum the queues are huge I used www.myvaticantour.com who offer several others. The guides speak excellent English and you are provided with headphones so that you can hear through the crowds. * Buy a Tour Bus and Boat ticket. These can be purchased from either onboard the bus or at one of their kiosks. They are valid for 24 or 48hrs and are a great way to see the sights. You can hop on or off at any of the designated stops * Take Bus 87 to the Colosseum it stops right outside. Tickets can be purchased for 1 EUR from any Tabacchi but are only valid for 75 minutes. Be warned, trying to get a bus back is a little less simple as none seem to head in the right direction (this is where the above tour bus comes in handy as buses come every 15mins) * Try to eat away from the main attractions. The side roads just along from the Spanish Steps are very reasonable with a meal and soft drinks costing approx 22 Euros (this is in comparison to a restaurant near the Vatican which charged 45 Euros for practically the same)

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Headabove
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 12-15th July 2008. I chose it because the price seemed reasonable, plus the reviews suggested a good location and reasonable place to stay. I have to agree, that it definitely scores well. The room was quite small, but this wasn't a problem for us. The air conditioning was essential, even for mid july, and it enabled a good nights' sleep and the ability to keep the windows closed, so cutting out any street noise (we were on the first floor facing the main street) and avoiding any insect bites... Breakfast is a cold buffet, which is fine - but I didn't rate the coffee to highly. As far as restaurants in the area are concerned, Pizzeria Roma is OK, Vito's seems a bit overpriced and definitely catering for tourists... Better off crossing the bridge and heading for Trattoria Buca di Ripetti, which is excellent, fairly priced, and catering more for trendy Romans rather than tourists. I have nothing against tourists, but the places that cater for them I feel are best avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, air-conditioned, great choice”
Reviews.Author: NOFXmike
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Diplocatic for just over a week in early August of 2007 and had a great time. The room was decent size (comparable to any holiday inn room), had air conditioning, buffet breakfast was included, was quiet, and met all of our needs. Great location just a few minutes walk to Castel Sant Angelo, other than that there is a bus stop 3 feet from the door, so it's simple to get anywhere in town. VERY good location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Visit”
Reviews.Author: DesertDweller
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at this property in room 502. Room was adequete size, towels changed daily, sheets were not. Only one outlet, in the bathroom, to charge my camera and iPod. Irons are not allowed. Safe and mini frig in room. Breakfast consisted of a variety of pastries, juice, ham, salami, swiss cheese, cold cereal (but room temp milk....odd) yogurt. Staff brings coffee, but not all that quickly. Internet for guests was down the entire time we were there, and no one was quite sure where the nearest internet cafe was. Internet worked fine for the staff.... Front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. City buses and the 110 tour bus stop right outside the door. We were able to get all around the city very easily. We walked to the Vatican, the Spanish steps, and Piazza Navona. Bussed it to the Colosseum. The front desk was very helpful in telling us which bus would get us where. The restaurant next door (Proffesionalist?) was nice for coffee and pastries. The hotel staff recommends Vito's for dinner, but we prefered Clok, right across the street from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: witchesofeastwick
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Rome with my sisters.We had adjacent rooms that were very clean and comfortable. Our rooms faced a very quiet street and we were not disturbed by any traffic noise. The breakfast was a cold buffet but there was ample choice and the staff were very friendly. This hotel is very convenient to all the great sights in Rome. We walked everywhere and felt very safe even at night. I will return to Rome again and I will definitely stay at the Diplomatic hotel again. We did not avail of the hotel taxi to the airport as this was 60 euro but we walked to taxi rank at end of road and taxi was only 40 euro .

Reviews.Title: “Great Location ! !”
Reviews.Author: plum9195
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location - cannot say enough about how great the location is, truly it is- minutes from the Spanish Steps, the Vatican, and many other great attractions. The room was of a good size (compared to the 3 star we stayed at in Paris) and bath and shower were fine. A clock of some sort in the room would have been a nice touch. Traffic noise was noticable - ask for a room away from the street if that would bother you. Staff was hit and miss when it came to requests and customer service, but overall acceptable. Bed and pillows were comfortable. They did not change the sheets during our stay (4 nights), but might have if we had asked them to we did get new towels etc each day. Breakfast was simple - but at least they did let you drink all the coffee and juice you wanted. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really well placed hotel”
Reviews.Author: TRunningMan
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel as it seemed a good price for the convenience of being close to the centre of the City. It is really well situated and made our exploration of Rome very easy. Breakfast was quite simple but good quality. The room was comfortable, the bed was very firm. The toilet had a lingering sewage smell and despite reporting this nothing really seemed to be done to resolve the issue. It meant we needed to keep the door shut when we were in the room. The housekeeping was okay but they never cleaned the glasses we had used. We were on the first floor which by bad luck meant the there was a lot of noise early in the morning as the shop below was being renovated. The hotel staff were pleasant enough and very helpful. Marked the overall rating as Okay due to the smell in the toilet and the couple of minor housekeeping glitches.

Reviews.Title: “:)”
Reviews.Author: Yurtesen
Reviews.Content: I stayed during a business visit. It is in a good place, close to the city cente but not crowded.. walking distance to everywhere.. Very nice staf in th restaurant and veyr good breakfast.. Gokhan YURTESEN

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: kfinneg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here at the end of Oct 2007. The hotel is in a great location--close to Castel S'ant Angelo, the Vatican and Trevi Fountain. Also, if you need to take the bus, to go to the Coloseo for example, the bus stop is right outside the hotel. The staff was wonderful during our entire stay. They spoke very good english. They were very helpful with directions, they made taxi reservations for us ( we had to leave the hotel at 4 am to get to the airport) and recommended two outstanding restaurants. We would stay here again if we ever return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: jmjo48
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Diplomatic is in a great location, near the Castel Sant'Angelo. It is easy walking distance to the Vatican, the Spanish Steps and the Piazza del Popolo. The staff speak English well and we found them to be polite and helpful. We arrived in the morning and were able to check in. Our room faced the main street but with the windows closed, noise was not an issue. The room was of normal European hotel size and was clean. Our room had a deep bathtub with shower. The breakfast was good, with a server bringing out coffee drinks and the buffet included pastries, ham and cheese. We did have to turn in our key to the front desk when we would leave the hotel, but we didn't have a problem with this since the room had a modern electronic safe in it. We would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “One member of the reception staff is not at all diplomatic!”
Reviews.Author: janesmith73
Reviews.Content: The Hotel diplomatic in Rome is very central and is good enough value for money. The room we had was at the back of the hotel overlooking the courtyard and it was decorated to a good standard for a 3 star hotel. Breakfast is served form 6.30 until 10.30 which suits the needs of most people and it was of a good standard. The only thing that would put me off ever returning to the hotel is one of the male reception staff, quite young with glasses and dark, curly hair. I regret not complaining about him to management now as he can only really be described as extremely rude, almost on the verge of bullying the hotel guests. He had absolutely no customer service skills, an example of this being when two female guests asked him when their airport taxi would be arriving.He spoke to them in a really aggressive manner and argued that they had told him the wrong departure time the day before and that it was all their fault, instead of just picking up the phone and fixing the problem which would have taken a lot less time!. Another two female guests who tried to cancel a hotel taxi transfer four hours before it was due to arrive were told by him that they could not and that was that! I won't have to tell you his name as you will spot him by his awful manner the moment you have the misfortune to meet him! If he did not work here, the Hotel Diplomatic, would truly be a star buy.

Reviews.Title: “A great weekend staying at the Diplomatic!”
Reviews.Author: leahbailey
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great, and it made our stay in Rome excellent. We stayed in 404, which was on the road side. All 3 of us slept wonderfully - the traffic was not an issue for us! The air conditioning worked, a bonus! The breakfast was good also, a good choice- with cereals, meats, cheese, pastries and cakes, yoghurts. Also great that the bus stops outside. Not too far a walk to Piazza Navona for a nighttime treat! Had a great time and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some TLC”
Reviews.Author: OnOurList
Reviews.Content: We made our hotel reservation at the last minute with few choices. We stayed five nights and would not stay at this hotel again. Positives: 1) we booked a double and were given a triple--the room was quite large for two people. 2) the breakfast room and courtyard were the most pleasant part of the hotel, 3) the in-room safe was large enough to hold a laptop. 4) the air conditioning was adequate in the over 90 degree heat. 5) the rooms had sound attenuation features which muffled some noises. 6) the floors in the room were smooth laminate that was cleaner that typical hotel carpet. 7) Luca at front desk was helpful. Negatives: 1) the room had a strong musty mildew smell and the air filter in the room was years overdue for a change. 2) the bathtub/shower had live mold growing and the tub did not drain during use, or for about 15 minutes after use. 3) there was no wireless internet access in the room, but there was a single computer at a tiny desk near the breakfast room for public access to the internet. The charge was one euro for every fifteen minutes. If you use the computer, check your bill carefully, we were overcharged. 4) our room faced the street and the noise was disturbing until after midnight and again before 6AM. 5) we did not ride the public transportation that was conveniently located in front of the hotel, but we heard and smelled the loud diesel engines of the buses. 6) to reach the hotel's elevator, it is necessary to climb about four or five steps. 7) there was only one electrical outlet in the room and it was used by the flat screen TV. One outlet in the bathroom was not reasonably accessible for any other use. Overall, this hotel does not live up to its potential, largely due to its lack of proper maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain holiday”
Reviews.Author: dancingladyNIreland
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week in Rome staying in the Diplomatic Hotel, via vittoria, colonna. We found the stafff at reception to be more than helpful and all english speaking. On arrival we were given a room at the front of the hotel, it was dire, dark and dreary, we asked to be moved and sure enough the next morning we were, all we had to do was pack our suitcases and the staff moved all for us. The room was of a better standard and is shown on the trip advisor website. Also the front of the hotel opens onto the street and could be quite noisy from early morning. We took the tour bus on the 2nd day to accustom ourselves to the city and found it a great help in deciding what we wanted to see and how to get there. On other days we walked and on 2 days we got the bus, 4 euro for one full day getting on and off as many times as you like, it is a real cheap way to see Rome. Beware of pick pockets as they are rife especially round the bus depots and buses but thankfully we weren't one of their victims. The Diplomatic is central to everything, 10 mins from the Vatican and probably the same to the shops.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: ehogan
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a district that is within walking distance of most major attractions. It is located next to the Hall of Justice on the Vatican side of the Tiber. About a 5-10 minute walk to the Vatican and 15 minutes to the Spanish Steps. The room (double) was large with a lovely washroom. In the morning a complimentary continental breakfast is served with excellent capuccino and espresso. There is bus service directly in front of the hotel, however we walked everywhere including walking to the Metro station at the Spanish steps with our luggage (one wheeled case each). I would definately recommend this hotel, and we would return to it again on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!! Don't bother looking anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: MrsJW
Reviews.Content: The Diplomatic was the ideal place to stay as it is situated within easy walking distance of ALL the sites, and near to the river. If strolling around doesn't appeal, or you want to get your bearings before you start you can literally walk out of the door onto the tour bus which stops directly outside every few minutes. The rooms are extremely clean with modern bathrooms - and a long deep bath which I loved after all that walking (just allow plenty of time for it to fill!). I think it's true to say that the front rooms are slightly bigger but the back rooms are quieter. As we went in March and were happy to close the window at night we opted for space - having said that we were so tired every night we could probably have slept on the road itself and not heard the traffic! The breakfasts are excellent - fruit, yogurt, juice, bread, sheeses, cold meats and a variety of delicious warm pastries - oh, and some of the best cappucino you'll find anywhere in Rome! There's no bar or restaurant but we got take-away gin and tonics from Proffesionalist next door at 'getting ready to go out for the evening' time (and then bedtime pastries and capuccinos as a nightcap after dinner!) and found several good eating places. Vito, down the street opposite was our favourite but ask the friendly receptionist where he would recommend. We're 2 ladies in our 40s and we felt perectly safe walking around this area at night. I can't write any more - it's making me pine to be on the next plane back! Stay at The Diplomatic - you'll love it!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy your stay in Rome with Diplomatic!”
Reviews.Author: Cathyboop
Reviews.Content: Enjoy your stay in Rome with Diplomatic hotel! I spent 3 days in Rome at the Diplomatic hotel 3 stars hotel with my best friend fews days ago, and we are absolutly enjoyed of our stay!The hotel is small but very nice, in the heart of the city, close to every thing(Monuments (St Peters church) Shopping area , bars and restaurants.People who worked there are very friendly and help us informing us about city and attractions during the whole stay. Our room was very clean and ideal to have rest! We hope to come back at Hotel Diplomatic as soon as possible!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Easy”
Reviews.Author: Bacchusman
Reviews.Content: Firstly I couldn't believe the value for money at this hotel. Myself and a friend booked a twin room for three nights Thurs, Fri and Sat for a great price of £66 per night for the room including a buffet continental breakfast. The hotel is located just North of the river and a five minute walk from the Vatican and 5 Mins from the Spanish Steps. There are two Metro stations within a few mins walk that can take you to most parts of the city and there is a bus stop right outside the front door. The room was very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was clean with towels replaced daily as you would expect. The breakfast was continental style and included juices, cereals, tea, coffee, ham, cheese, salami, fresh bread rolls, yoghurt, fruit salad and peches in syrup. There was also dutch toast with a choice of preserves. The breakfast room was spacious and the staff polite. The reception was small but tasteful and the reception staff were polite and helpful (also English speaking which helps) I would recommend this hotel. Certainly for the money we paid, to have found fault we would have to have looked for it. We travelled to Rome to watch a rugby match and despite the fact we lost we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: CarolBelfast
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel for 3 nights in February and would certainly return to the Diplomatic if/when we return to Rome. The location of the Hotel was ideal, you can walk to all of the main highlights within the city. However, if you don't want to walk there is a bus stop immediately in front of the Hotel where you can get the open top tour bus and local buses. The staff were helpful, breakfast was adequate to get you started in the morning and the rooms, though small, were spotlessly clean. The only negative comment we have is that the rooms can get hot at night and you can't control the temperature. Also, it is 'illegal' to use an iron in the hotel so make sure you pack everything well. Overall a good hotel which is reasonably priced in an excellent loction.

Reviews.Title: “loved the vatican city”
Reviews.Author: yampip
Reviews.Content: we stayed two nites at this hotel, very friendly & helpful staff. room fair size with minibar and nice continental breakfast. Great location for most sites, vatican city about 20min walk. Lots of shops & bars nearby. Vitos just across road from hotel great place to eat with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: travellerwills
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning of Feb and found the hotel to be in a good location (Spanish Steps 10 min walk, St Peter's Square & Vatican around 15 mins) Staff were helpful, rooms a little small maybe but clean. Only "complaint" would be we found it a little noisy in the mornings - from about 7.30 it sounded as if the whole hotel had congregated outside our room for a chat! However, I think we just had noisy neighbours! Overall, a nice enough hotel in a decent location offering good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Ok for Rome standards”
Reviews.Author: petraleon
Reviews.Content: Nice location between Vatican, Spanish steps and Piazza Navona, with several restaurants and coffee shops. We had a room facing the street which was ok for the view but there was much noise coming from the street at nights even though we stayed on the fifth floor. Our heating broke down and we had to change room, but on the fifth floor, both rooms we stayed weren΄t warm. We complained about not having hot water in the morning (it was hardly warm) and we were told that they can't do anything because all the hotel guests are taking a shower this time of the day. Staff friendly except from the manager who was quite arrogant. The worst impression was that we were tricked by the reception to book a taxi to the airport one day before leaving (they said they couldn΄t do it on the same day). Instead of a taxi, an old hotel van took us to the airport with the same price but it needed double the time (50 minutes). To sum up, I wouldn't say it's a bad choice but don't expect too much

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Czech_traveller
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location in a nice area close to the Vatican as well as main shopping area and lots of restaurants. Rooms are average size, very modern and spotlessly clean. Don't expect much a view though - ours looked into a closed courtyard, but at least it was quiet. Reception was efficient and friendly, not so cheerful at breakfast and not alot of choice but what there was was fine. No restaurant or bar in the hotel but a nice coffee house just along the street. Heating seemed to be centrally controlled so may be too hot., cold in the room for some people but was fine for us. Overall was good value at 110 euro a night and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best choise you can have...”
Reviews.Author: panpolypls
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights from 14 to 18 of December 2006. Location was good but not perfect. Rooms were ok, but really very hot.(there was central heating so we could not turn it off) Breakfast was very bad and the stuff was really rude. If you are planning to visit Rome try to find a hotel closer to Spanish steps or Navona square, with more and better servises. As a conlusion i can say that Diplomatic Hotel is an average(or below average) Hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: BaltNj
Reviews.Content: Hotel Diplomatic was perfect for what we wanted, a reasonable priced nice hotel in a good location. The bathrooms were fantastic and spotless. The rooms were ok, a good value. The location was great, near the river and the Castle de San Angelo...we could always find either and find our way back easily. Not a honeymoon hotel, but a perfect tourist hotel. Nice breakfast, good service all around.

Reviews.Title: “top class”
Reviews.Author: junowag
