Reviews.Content: well i stayed in hotel last week and the staff were lovely ,very helpful and rooms were very clean , breakfast was different, but i enjoyed the change.. good choices ,i travelled on my own and felt very secure in the hotel, the hotel was so centeral 10 mins walk from vatican and a nice walk over the bridge and straight on to the spainsh steps and pass all the desinger shops on way...i will go back again.. and i hope on my visit to milan next year i find a hotel as nice as the diplomatic... mags eire

Reviews.Title: “unfriendly!”
Reviews.Author: twickenham
Reviews.Content: I stayed in hotel diplomatic for 4 nights in september. Upon arrival we were treated very unfriendly. The check-in person first wanted us to sign a piece of paper (in italian, so we had no idea what we were signing) and then he wanted to take our pasports ("i'll bring them to your room later" , when asked why , he could not explain it properly) , so we insisted on waiting while he was doing that "thing that he needed to do" . After 10mins we got the keys to our room & the pasports back. The room (n° 206) was really small, but everything was there. The minibar was locked up in a small cupboard, and was producing a lot of heat , so we always left the door open. The safe proved to be very usefull, pickpockets are really on every streetcorner! Breakfast staff was very friendly , but the menu was pretty dull, (no fresh juices, the same thing every morning). The day before we left, the check-in guy asked us if he could arrange a taxi to the airport , we kindly declined , as we wanted to go by train. He also asked us if we already had our traintickets , because he could "arrange" some. We didn't accept the offer and just bought them in the termini station. The hotel is situated quite close to all the major sites, but who wants to walk when you can take the bus right in front of the hotel, they are really easy and cheap. I would also recommend the ROMA PASS , 18 euro for 3 days, free bus rides, free access to the first 2 museums (without queuing !) (take the colloseum , most expensive and the longest waiting time) and losts of other price reductions.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Hotel in perfect position - County Durham UK”
Reviews.Author: Charnwood
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day visit to Rome after staying at the Hotel Diplomatic. Would highly recommend this hotel for position, cleanliness & helpful staff. On arrival at Ciampino airport we (party of 4) got a taxi to the hotel which took 40minutes and cost 56 Euro's - this was easier than the alternatives that were available ie bus from airport to Termini station then taxi to hotel. On arrival we were met by friendly staff and offered a choice of rooms. We choose a room at the front of the hotel and our friends choose a room at the back of the Hotel. The front rooms have views of the main street but can be noisy whereas the rooms at the back are quieter but have limited views. The rooms were clean, tidy and modern with a range of facilities including TV, mini bar, hairdrier etc (no iron/ironing board however). Breakfast was fine with a range of cereals, hot/cold drinks, ham, salami. cheeses, yoghurt, fruit salad and danish pasteries. We saw all the main sights and as the Hotel is in a perfect position it does'nt take long to walk to them all. On leaving the hotel head Left to see Castle D'Sant Angelo, The Vatican & Cistene Chapel - will take approx 15 minutes to reach the vatican. On leaving the hotel head Right to see the Piaza Navona, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Collusseum & all the designer fashion shops - Trevi Fountain at night is a spectacular view not to be missed. There's a wide range of restaurants available but like others who have stayed at this hotel our finest meal BY FAR was at the Picola Irpina its used by the locals and is'nt full of tourists. There's a good choice of food on the menu which is fresh, reasonably priced and is full of flavour --- To get to this restaurant turn right as you come out of the hotel cross the main walk for 20 yards then turn left and its approx 800 yards along the side street (at night its shown with a green neon sign saying Tratoria). Hope your stay in Rome is fab and if you choose this hotel you won't be disapointed...... Ciao.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: caracalla
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend have just returned from a 2 night stay at Hotel Diplomatic and it was a very pleasant stay. Our room on the fifth floor was situated at the front, was quite large and it had a balcony with a lemontree. The bathroom in marble was rather small but it had everything you need and every day clean toweles. The room had also a big closet that was very practical to put your luggage away. The breakfast was nothing special but we did enoy to eat outside on the terras and the waitress was very helpfull to bring us coffee, hot chocolat, cappucino... and to make us feel comfortable. The location of the hotel is good, the Vatican and Spanish Steps are not far away. There is a bus stop in front of the hotel. . How to reach the hotel from Ciampino airport? We took the cheapest way: take a cotral bus (1euro) to the Anangina metrostation (1euro) and get off at Spagna. From there we walked to the hotel. You can also take the bus to the hotel - it stops right in front of it - but then you have got to get of at the Termini Station and take bus 70 (1euro) at the back of the station. A little bit more expansive but more comfortable: the Terravision bus: 13,50 euros (return). More information and experiences from passengers on (--) Hotel Diplomatic is a very good hotel, I could recommend it to everyone. We got more then we expected and were in no way disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, pity about the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: PaulFranks
Reviews.Content: Stayed for seven nights in August 2006. Plus points: excellent location, helpful staff, good quality rooms and bathrooms with hairdryer, bidet, bath and good shower. Negative points: dull and unchanging breakfast - cornflakes, tinned fruit, yoghourt, poor rolls, cheese and meat slices. Good coffee though! Our room at the back had a view only of the grotty backs of other buildings plus the small hotel patio, but it had the advantage of being very quiet at night.. One tip: there is a free safe in the room. Do use it to keep cards and surplus money in. We were pickpocketed at Termini station and the hotel staff told us it happens all the time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: spark26
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Diplomatic for 3 nights and our only wish was that we could have stayed there longer. We arrived in Rome at about 5pm so the traffic was bad - it cost us €40 to get from Termini to the hotel but the taxi driver did warn us it would take about 25-30 minutes to get there. Once at Hotel Diplomatic it is about 15 minutes walk to get to Piazza Navona. It is very close to Castell Sant'Angelo. There is a bus stop outside the hotel for buses to the Colliseum and the tourist bus also stops outside the hotel. We really enjoyed the breakfast and thought there was plenty of choice with friendly staff offering a choice of coffee. The room was large compared to other hotels we have stayed in in Italy with a double bed, 2 couches, table and 2 chairs. There was a mini-bar and safe in the room and although our safe wasn't working at the time there was no problem in keeping our valuables in the hotel lobby's safe. All the desk staff we encountered were very friendly and gave us good advice. The taxi back to Termini at 11am on Sunday cost €15. When we return to Rome we will definitely stay at the Hotel Diplomatic although we'll probably get the Metro to Lepanto and walk from there instead of a taxi. However, I wouldn't recommend doing this with heavy luggage as it is quite far - about 15-20 minutes walk but will probaaly feel more with luggage

Reviews.Title: “3 nights in July”
Reviews.Author: workshy1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in July and it was absolutely lovely. The breakfast staff was exceptional - great coffee especially. The room was comfortable, quiet and above all, air-conditioned. The bathroom was very clean and has modern amenities. We couldn't have asked for a better value at a great location in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: NKDEVLIN
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Diplomatic for 4 nights from 4th July and had a wonderful time. The hotel is extremely clean and airy, the rooms are larger than you would expect and the bathrooms are a beautiful cool marble. The air conditioning is almost silent! There is an external patio in the centre of the hotel, with table and chairs under cool umbrellas, which is attached to the breakfast room serving a good continental breakfast by very pleasant staff. The front desk staff speak perfect English and Claudio in particular is wonderful, keen to debate football, roman history and the opinions of his grandmother, he entertained us whilst we waited for the excellent door to door tours he arranged for us with Carrani Tours (we took these for ease because of the scorching heat). I can thoroughly recommend this hotel. We did however arrive during a taxi drivers strike (it was never clear why they chose to randomly take strike action) which made us use public transport from the start as we had intended to take a taxi from Ciampino until we were familiar with the public transportation system. It was probably a blessing because once we had the route to the Diplomatic clear it was very easy. Bearing in mind a taxi from the airport is E48 and during the taxi strike rebel taxis are/were holding people to ransom and charging double the normal fares. This is how to do it - There are numerous coaches from the airport into Termini charging E6 one way and E10 return to Termini (incl Easyjet). At the airport or Termini buy a day ticket for E4 which will allow you to travel on buses, trams and metro. At Termini you can then take either the no 70 bus directly to the hotel or take the metro A line to Lapanto and walk down Via M A Colonna to the Diplomatic. There are nine buses which stop outside this hotel, the 70, 78, 81, 87, 186, 224, 492, 913, 926 which are available on the public transport ticket and a hop-on-hop-off private trambus no 110. Having mastered this we refused to use taxis at all on principle and toured Rome by public transport. Wherever we ended up as we walked about Rome we simply looked at one of the many bus stops and we were guaranteed a bus to get us back to the hotel. Members recommended Ristorante la Piccola Irpina, we agreed, we had the best antipasta first course buffet ever, so good we went back to it for the main course too! I hope this review is of help to you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Navgirl63
Reviews.Content: We were greeted upon arrival with a cappucino while I rooms were being cleaned. The staff was great, the service was excellent for the continental breakfast. The beds were sufficient, nothing to write home about, but the bathrooms were wonderful. They were a tad bit small, but very nicely decorated in a dark colored marble. I had a room with a nice balcony that was great to kick back and drink a glass of wine and view the city. The hotels location was great. We were basically in walking distance to just about all the great sites in Rome...less than a 10 minute walk to the Vatican. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: amoboo
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at the Diplomatic and found it to be an ideal location: ten minutes from St. Peter's, ten minutes from Piazza Navona. Bus stop outside was very convenient too. The review from Papplewick (March 2006) says it all (and was very useful:thanks.) Ristorante la Piccola Irpina is to be recommended as is Vito's Bar (pricier). Hotel staff were very helpful, the room was spotless and the continental breakfasts fine. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly best 3 star hotel I've stayed in....”
Reviews.Author: RubeB
Reviews.Content: Got a lot more than we expected in this 3 star hotel -very clean good sized room, excellent buffet breakfast and very friendly and helpful staff in a great location and at a great price. Would have no hesitation in going back there to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at this hotel very much. The location is splendid and the rooms are comfy and nice. Unlike other reviewers, we actually enjoyed the breakfast, especially the brioche with different cream fillings. "When in Rome do as Romans do", starting with the breakfast, right? A trip to Piazza Cavour just around the corner is recommended, there you will find excellent restaurants and gelaterias.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: aklein1022
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Diplomatic for six nights in early March. Our room had a king sized bed, cable TV (but only one English channel - CNN) a refrig, safe, and a very nice tiled bathroom with shower and bath tub. The room was very comfortable and fairly large. It was located in the front of the building on Via Vittoria Colonna. Unlike some other TA comments, we found the room farily quiet - probably because our windows were closed at night. All the staff were extremely helpful - from the front desk staff who were very willing to answer questions, to the housecleaning staff who kept our room immaculate. The on-off 110 bus stops right in front of the hotel as does four other city buses that will take you pretty much wherever you may want to go. Across the street is a Tabaccheria (Bar) where you can purchase your 1 Euro bus tickets. There are some good shops along the street for cloths shopping and a few bar/resturants. We ate at Ristorante La Piccola Irpinia - just a short block away and enjoyed our dinner very much. Very local crowd - no tourists. The one feature of the hotel which did not meet our expectations was the limited breakfeast menu. Only canned fruit, sweet rolls, and very little protein. It was served in a nice breakfeast room, but it got very cramped and noisy. Overall, a very nice stay and a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kmevans56
Reviews.Content: We took a short break to Rome (4 days) and found the Hotel Diplomatic to be within a good, short distance of all the main attractions such as the Spanish Steps and the Vatican. The staff were friendly and helpful and, although we did not spend too much time in the room (too busy walking everywhere!) we found the room to be comfortable and clean. It was a little on the small side but, for the price, a bargain nonetheless. The breakfast was not really all that and was quite limited, they could improve this aspect of their service. I stayed there 20 years ago and not much has changed, if it ain't broke don't fix it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: sacky
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 4 nights at the Hotel Diplomatic last week and were very impressed with this hotel. Friendly staff, spotlessly clean rooms and excellent location. The breakfast room was relaxing, comfortable and the lady who served tea/coffee was a delight!! Not only was her coffee delicious but she stayed in the back room to ensure guests had privacy to eat. There was plenty on offer too - cereals, yogurts, fruit, crisy rolls,ham, cheese salami and a delicious selection of pastries. My only critism would be that the room we were allocated to was very warm and when the window was opened it was extremely noisy with the outside traffic. I would recommend that you ask for a back room - in fairness to the hotel we actually got the choice but did not know at that point what to opt for!! If your fit and healthy then you can walk to all the main spots, the hotel is placed in a great location. The day before we were going home the hotel receptionist enquired if we needed assistance with travel to the airport - he arranged a hotel taxi to take us for 48 euros. Would definetly stay at the Diplomatic again, we had a very pleasant stay indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely! It was a short, pleasant walk to the Vatican, Spanish Steps and more attractions. The rooms were very nice, marble bathrooms, perfect cleanliness, excellent maid service and a very attentive staff. My aging mother will never forget the assistance of Signore Claudio at the front desk who kept reminding her not to leave her purse open for thieves! He also arranged train tickets for us to make a day trip to Florence and gave us specific directions as to where we should go in the stations and in Florence itself. I've never had such wonderful personal assistance from hotel staff and would return to the Diplomatic before choosing any other hotel. The only downside of this hotel is that they do tend to overbook and move later arrivals elsewhere. If they move you to another three-star hotel, the odds are that you will not get the same quality. This hotel could easily make four stars but I understand that they choose purposely to remain at the three star rating.

Reviews.Title: “lovely and clean with great location”
Reviews.Author: maidens
Reviews.Content: my friends and i stayed here for 7 nights in august and we all thought the location could not have been better. the first thing i look for when booking a hotel is cleanliness and this hotel more than lived up to this. bathroom was lovely with an excellent shower. you have castel sant angelo and vatican in one direction and all the other sights in the other, we walked to all of them. the collesseum was furthest away around 20 minute walk. restaurant accross the road vito's bar was superb so we ate there almost every night, house red wine is also good. restaurant next door was very good as well. rome was not as expensive as we were lead to believe, we were paying 100 euros for meals for 4 of us including 2 jugs of wine and that was fillet steaks as well. rome is a fab city, all the sights are amazing, you will not be dissapointed, and i`d thoroughly recomend the hotel diplomatic which we booked through [--] at 90 euros per night for a twin room b/b. go and enjoy, we loved every minute.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: JoyInTravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Diplomatic for three nights. The staff was friendly and helpful. I noticed I had booked the wrong time for my limo service return trip as I was coming in, but the limo driver couldn't speak English. The desk clerk called for me and had the new time within minutes. As I'm American, they automatically placed me in a non-smoking room and even though the porter had already brought me upstairs, they had no problem changing me to a smoking room. The room itself, a double, was large and clean with a small balcony. Breakfast was ok, standard meat/cheese/yogurt/cereal, but the cappacino was good. There is a small lounge/bar on the first floor by the breakfast room. Don't know if there is a bartender, only used it while waiting for my limo. Hotel is also very close to all the major sights. There is a bus stand across the street for those who don't like to walk and the 110 tourist bus stops literally in front of the hotel. There is a shop across the street that sells bus tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Basic”
Reviews.Author: Cumbria72
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at The Diplomatic Hotel for 5 nights in November 2005. We booked it through the Easy Jet internet site & got direct flights from Newcastle to Ciampino Airport. The hotel is just over the river a basic hotel but we never spent much time in it only to sleep & to get a freshen up to go out in the evening. The staff were pleasant & the breakfast simple but with all the places to eat in Rome you should'nt go hungry. We only had one problem which was on our first night there. After a long day of travelling and seeing the sights all we wanted to do was to go to sleep & wake up refreshed for the next day....In our room we shared an adjoining door with the other room which was not good lets just say that the couple next door were a gay couple and we could hear everything that was going on as clear as day. We were tired & did'nt want to listen to that so my husband went down to see the guy on reception who basically said that there was nothing he could do that the hotel was fully booked up & that we would have to wait until tomorrow & that if the noises carried on to knock on the other rooms door!!! The noises got worse so we went down again. My husband told the guy on reception that we can't stand to listen to that & asked him if he could move us to another hotel if they could'nt accomodate us here. With that the receptionist changed his tune and said that there was a room but it was a suite and that we would have to pay for it - my husband told him why should we pay for something that is'nt our fault after abit of a debate he said we could stay there for the night & that they would put us in another room tomorrow which was fine by us. After that we had no problems. For our first visit to Rome it was a good one yes the hotel was ok. We plan to go back soon we would'nt stay in the Diplomatic again not because of the first night incident, but because i think that there are better hotels out there and in better locations.

Reviews.Title: “One Bad Apple Ruins the Bunch”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having booked our reservation two months in advance and then called the day we were arriving to advise of a late arrival and verify that our room would be held...you can imagine how we felt when we showed up and were told that there was "problems with the system" and the hotel had been overbooked. What happened from there was what i can only summarize as the worst customer service i've ever received--my husband and I have never been spoken to like we were that night--and certainly not by anyone who's job it is to serve customers. We were initially told that we would be accomodated at another of the group's hotels across town (and were supposed to be comforted by the fact that they would cover the cab fare). This was not ok. We picked the hotel because of the location and were quite upset. After a bit of arguing the concierge finally changed his tune and admitted that there was one room left, but it was a suite and he would have to get special permission to give it to us and we would have to move out "immediately" the next morning. After verfying with his boss that he could infact give a room to a couple who had reserved a room (seems like common sense to me) he took our passports and our reservation confirmation and refused to give it back to us until the next morning. we politely explained that we would be happy to wait for him to copy down our passport information--no rush, but we'd prefer to just wait and get them back--and we at least wanted a copy of our reservation seeing as it was the only thing we had to prove that we had a reservation at this hotel that had given away our room. He started yelling at us and saying that it wasnt America and this wasnt how things worked and we needed to "hit the road and travel a bit" (funny...since we had been in 6 countries in the previous 2 weeks...). Though he finally gave us our passports back, he refused to give us our reservation confirmation sheet and when we said we felt more comfortable keeping it, he grabbed the key out of the valet's hand and said "Well i will not give you a room then. Its one or the other." Though we finally worked it out...it was not what i wanted to pay $200 a night to go through. The fairly nice accomodations and good location were completely irrelevant after such a horrible "welcome."

Reviews.Title: “Overly Satisfied with Modest Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: ladolcevida17
Reviews.Content: This "diamond in the rough" hotel was ideal for our four night stay in August. A modest yet comfortable hotel room which met our standard needs. We wanted a safe. clean, comfortable, reasonably priced hotel with air conditioning. Our accomodations were met and we were overly satisfied with the helpful hotel staff who communicated in English. The room was simple with all the necessary amenities. The centralized location was close to public transportion. Within a half of block, the taxis were lined up and available to wisk you off to your next tourist attraction. If you were more adventurous, the public bus stopped within twenty steps of the hotel. The tour buses picked us up right in front. You could walk to some of the sites (20-30 minutes) but it is easy to take a wrong turn besides there is enough walking once you get to a site. A couple of nearby eating establishments (within a block or two) were open late when the end of a long day left you a bit hungry. Although there were few places in Rome that had real air conditioning, this hotel was cool and refreshing on those hot, humid days. We would recommend this hotel if your do not need a lot of frills. Breakfast was adequate, cappucino wonderful, but we ended up missing a few due to early morning tours. The hotel was nice enough to let us grab a croissant or two to take with us.

Reviews.Title: “Top Location”
Reviews.Author: TheNorthsider
Reviews.Content: Average Hotel, but in a great location close to the Castel Sant Angelo, Basilica but also within walking distance of the main shopping areas and restaurants. Room was clean with good aircon as it was quite humid during the visit, bathroom was really clean etc. There was a TV which didn't get used as there is just too much to see in this city. Breakfast was basic but nice with croissants, cereals, ham, cheeses, salami constantly replenished by the excellent staff (all spoke good english). Coffee was really nice. Have not stayed elsewhere in Rome so dont know about value for money but struggeld to get anywhere close to this price in the centre for this particular weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: maird
Reviews.Content: Excellent locaction, friendly, helpful staff. Stayed for 3 nights in August and could recommend this hotel to anyone and we will certainly be using it again next time in Rome. This is not a "top class" hotel with all of the frills but it is extremely clean and everthing is on the doorstep. The staff go out of there way to be helpful. Billingham, Cleveland, UK

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: helenyw
Reviews.Content: Went there with a friend and stayed for 2 nights. Hotel is just across the bridge some 15 minutes away from Piazza di Spagna, and slightly further to the Vatican. Be sure to visit Castel Sant'Angelo nearby - the secret passage between this and the Vatican was open the weekend we were there (only one weekend every year!) and there was a special festival going on inside the castle all night! We had a clean twin room, and it was actually not a bad size - sufficient space between the beds and the wall, the bathroom was quite big (bathtub, bidet, toilet, and a big space around the sink to put all our creams and make up). Breakfast was okay, just some cold meats, yogurt, and cereal. Would I recommend it? We paid around £70 a night, so not too bad for Rome. But treat the hotel as somewhere you just go back and spend the night as there is nothing all that special about it.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star Guest House”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Diplomatic Hotel for 25th-29th June 2005 and would hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an over priced guest house in a central location. This hotel or should we say guest house has a very small reception area on the ground floor. The breakfast room and terrace are on the first floor with a small window-less tv room adjacent. As far as I could ascertain there were no other public rooms in this 'hotel'. My room on the first foor was a relatively small twin bedded room, clean with a comfortable bed and good linen, tv in the bedroom showing only Italian channels. The bathroom, though small, was very clean with an excellent shower and clean towels daily. The airconditioning on the first night was excellent but sadly failed on day two of my stay. The hotel was without airconditioning on both the second and third nights and was somewhat restored by the fourth night although it was very poor. The electricity failed due to an internal fault on the third day leaving the hotel without power for some hours. Breakfast was fairly basic and adequate with one disturbing factor. There is a refrigerated display but the staff chose to stock this with tinned fruit and yogarts leaving the cold meats and cheese lying on a table next to it, except for day 3 of my stay when the meats were in the refrigerated cabinet. Given that breakfast service begins at 6.00 am and continues until 10.00 am I didn't risk eating the cold meats at 9.45 am when they looked a little 'tired' to say the least. The breakfat staff were very polite and helpful. The furniture on the terrace is somewhat worn and chipped with large chunks of melamine missing from the table tops, hardly hygenic in a food service area. The hotel was in a great location for sightseeing 15-20 mins walk from all the major attractions. The desk staff were all extremely pleasant and helpful although there can be a problem with late night entry. On my first evening I arrived back at the hotel to discover a notice on the door saying 'Will be back shortly'. Some twenty minutes later the night porter appeared apologising saying that he had been doing 'room service'. The same happened on night two, only this time the excuse was that he was trying to repair the airconditioning. Not what one wants to hear when one has been standing on the door step for twenty minutes. You have potential Diplomatic, pull your socks up.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing ambience and service”
Reviews.Author: 4evertravel
Reviews.Content: Having stayed the previous week at a hotel similarly located for less money, was disappointed in the ambience and service. Rooms were very, very dark with no control over the room temperature. Front desk was not helpful with directions unlike our experience at other hotels and somewhat standoffish when asked questions such as cost of in-room phone calls and the availability of internet service. Neighborhood is non-descript but hotel is close to the locations described in their website. Be aware that the hotel restaurant, piano bar and rooftop terrace are NOT at this location but at a sister hotel. Some references we read on other websites did not make this clear.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Diplomatic Hotel for 4 nights in June 2005 and would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a reasonably priced hotel in a central location. The room was a reasonable size and the bathroom, though small, was new and very clean. We were on the fifth floor at the back and it was very quiet. Breakfast was fairly basic but perfectly adequate. The hotel was in a great location for sightseeing. We walked everywhere, even to the Colosseum which took about half an hour. The Spanish Steps and Piazza Navona are about ten minutes away and St Peters/the Vatican about 15 minutes. If you don’t want to walk, the open top sightseeing bus stops right outside the hotel. When we arrived in Rome, we took the train from the airport to Termini and then a taxi to the hotel. This took a long time and worked out quite expensive. It might be better to try the airport shuttle service operated by the hotel, which we used on our return journey, or one of the other shuttle services advertised locally.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: suzsull48
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Diplomatic Hotel, Rome for a long weekend. Although the facilities are very basic this is an excellent hotel if you wish to see the sights of Rome. Its location couldn't have been better and both the Vatican and all the other sights of Rome were within easy walking distance. We stayed on the third floor at the back which was very quiet. The layout of the bedroom was OK but the bathroom was very cramped. We did actually peep into one of the rooms at the front and it was much better. The breakfasts were good, albeit there was not a great deal of choice. As there isn't a restaurant for evening meals at this hotel we would recommend Vito's Bar/Restaurant which is just across the road. The food there is excellent. All in all we enjoyed our stay at the Diplomatic but would probably not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: lezlieb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from March 9-15, 2005. Our room was huge by European Standards. The bathroom was also a good size. The rooms were clean and the staff was very friendly. The location is excellent. Everything is within walking distance and it is in a quiet part of town. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Staff”
Reviews.Author: Atlantis371
Reviews.Content: My son and I spent Christmas in Rome. It was very enjoyable and had a wonderful time. Hotel location is fantastic. You can walk almost everywhere and go back to the hotel to drop things off or rest for some minutes before going out again. You can catch any bus right in front. Front desk staff was really nice and helpful. Breakfast was very good and waitresses were very kind. I am looking forward to going back to Rome and for sure will stay at the Diplomatic again. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “great position,would recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: janetdono
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from Rome staying at the hotel Diplomatic which we found a very easy place to get to and from to all the attractions in Rome. We caught the bus from the airport into the terminni with no hassle and then we did have a bit of trouble finding the bus stop for the bus no.492 which drops you off outside the hotel. When getting off the airport bus you need to go across the road and via right to find the main bus station and there you can purchase your 1euro tickets, the bus stop is back down to where you got off the airport bus and then head in a straight line left and bus stop is just the other side of main road, easy when you know how! We found the breakfast excellent but there was nothing else there ie.bar or restaurent, probably because it was February! Do not eat at VICOSbar, as you will wait all evening and when it comes its a rip off. The place we loved was at the bottom of the road on the left facing the bridge /g.antonni -its awonderful place to go for lunch and the cakes in there are to die for! it is the cheapest place for really good cup or should I say 2cups of tea and only costs 90c,Hope you enjoy your visit

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: PatMez
Reviews.Content: Paid 100 euros a night for this hotel which was well worth the money. Brilliant location between the Spanish Steps and the Vatican, close to the River. Our double room was spacious, the bed huge and it had a lovely marble bathroom. Breakfast was fine with a choice of cereal, fruit, ham, cheese, croissants etc. Staff in the breakfast area and reception were friendly and helpful. Internet avaialble at the hotel for 3 euros for 30 minutes. Across the road from the hotel down a side street is Vitto's restaurant. Great food and drink, reasonably priced with really helpful, friendly staff it was so good we did not bother looking for other places to eat on a night.

Reviews.Title: “great choice”
Reviews.Author: sweetprimeras
Reviews.Content: spent two nights here got back 20th january. Hotel comfortable, room was a good size, bathroom nice modern and clean with great shower. The staff spoke english and were very helpful, was within walking distance to all main attractions although the open top bus stops right outside.Great wee guiness pub right across the road. would definately go back.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Diplomatic
HotelInfo.Address: Via Vittoria Colonna 28, 00193 Rome, Italy
